meta.name: description
meta.content: Sanford-Fritch ISD is located in Fritch, TX.

img.alt: Pole Vault at the Pantex Relays
HIgh Jump at the Pantex Relays

figcaption.p: High Jump at the Pantex Relays
Long Jump at the Pantex Relays.

div.div: In partnership with parents and the community, students will graduate with the skills needed to be career ready.

div.br: The Sanford Independent School District is a public school district originally organized in 1928 and based in Sanford, Texas. However, Sanford and the new neighboring town of Fritch (1933) become incorporated in 1956 and the district offices were moved into Fritch. The district name was officially changed to the Sanford-Fritch Independent School District in 2005.

The district encompasses slightly more than 33 square miles. It is located in the heart of the Panhandle oil field, along the southeast shore of Lake Meredith. In addition to Sanford and Fritch, the district serves the rural areas in southwestern Hutchinson County along with small portions of Carson and Moore counties which also lie within the district.

The SFISD is accredited by the Texas Education Agency and provides quality education for Pre-Kindergarten through 12th grade. The SFISD also partners with Frank Phillips College in Borger, Texas to offer students dual-credit and college credit courses. The SFISD is currently served by three campuses: Sanford-Fritch Elementary School, Sanford-Fritch Junior High School, and Sanford-Fritch High School.

div.div:
Beginning Monday, April 20, 2020; SFISD will begin providing meals to all children through age 18 in the SFISD community. Daily breakfast and lunches can be picked up in Fritch at the Elementary Cafeteria between 9:00 – 11:00 AM; they can also be picked up in Sanford at the corner of 687 & 1319 between 9:00 – 10:00 AM. Please do not get out of your car, we are happy to serve you. Meals will not be delivered to your home or business. The food service department will follow the 2019-2020 School Calendar. Meals will not be served on scheduled holidays or weekends and will end on May 21, 2020.
If you have not picked meals up but plan to start, please complete the survey by clicking the link below. This will help our food service department prepare the correct amount of meals. Thank You!
https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/SFISDCovid-19
Packets are available for Pre-Kinder and Kindergarten Roundup for any students who are new to the district.

Governor Abbott has closed all schools through April 3, 2020. With the Governor's order to close schools due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus), the SFISD will be closed to all non-essential personnel. Approved SFISD staff members may be present in the district; however, visitors will not be allowed in the buildings at this time. If you need anything, please contact the district at 806-397-0159. Click link for full updates
